_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



1.    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Certco Inc. Femrite Drive Facility complies with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations. All employees are informed of hazards in the workplace. Employees who work with potentially hazardous substances receive proper training in the handling of those substances. This facility has procedures in place to safely remove employees from areas in the unlikely event that a hazardous substance release were to occur, and to put in place emergency notification and action procedures.



2.    Facility and Regulated Substances

Certco Inc, Femrite Drive Facility is a grocery distribution center.  The facility utilizes Anhydrous Ammonia as a refrigerant to maintain the proper temperatures for storage of product.  Ammonia, a gas at normal atmospheric temperature and pressure, is used in an anhydrous form liquefied under pressure in a two stage process.  The refrigeration system consists of a High Pressure Receiver, Evaporators, Compressors, Condensers, Vessels, Piping and numerous types of Valves.  Certco Inc, Femrite Drive Facility has an integrated safety management program to prevent ammonia releases and mitigate the consequences of a release, should one occur.





3.    Worst Case and Alternative Case Release Scenarios

Off Site Consequence (OCA) data is available for review onsite at the Certco Inc. Femrite Drive Facility.





4.    General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia Specific Prevention

The Certco Inc, Madison, WI - Femrite Drive Facility has an emergency plan that addresses the actions necessary in the event of a release of ammonia from the refrigeration system. Because of the pungent odor of ammonia, any leak is easily detected. The compressor rooms are provided with ammonia detectors and visual alarms. The refrigeration system is designed so that major components can be isolated by closing selected valves. Further, refrigeration system operators and contr

actors have been trained and are knowledgeable in the safe operation of the refrigeration system.    In case of a release that could travel off the plant property, calls would be made to the Madison Fire Department and the appropriate agencies to assist in the response. Other state and federal notifications would be made as required.







5.    Five Year Accident History

There has not been a release of hazardous substance from the covered process within the pasts five years which resulted in death, injury, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.





6.    Emergency Response Program

This storage facility has procedures in place to react in the event of a release of a hazardous substance. Employees are trained to evacuate their respective areas in accordance with OSHA 1910.38(a). Coordination with the Dane County Emergency Management/LEPC, the Madison  Fire Department, and others is initiated during an emergency situation.





7.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Certco Inc. Femrite Drive Facility expects to improve safety performance by emphasizing all elements of its' PSM/RMP program.  All recommendations during the most recent Process Hazard Analysis and PSM Compliance Audit were designed to improve the safety performance of the ammonia refrigeration process.  Certco Inc, Femrite Drive Facility management expects to evaluate each recommendation in a timely manner and implement, as soon as possible, those recommendations that will reduce the possibility of a release and/or mitigate the consequences of an unintentional release.
